title: What were the key Roland Garros qualifying results?
description: Roland Garros qualifying action came to a close with final-round action Friday, when a host of players earned their way into the main draw of the clay-court major. Filip Misolic sprung an early third-round surprise by upsetting second seed Alexander Shevchenko 6-4, 6-4. The Austrian won 77 per cent (24/31) of points behind his first delivery, according to Infosys Stats, to wrap an 87-minute victory and qualify for the main draw in Paris for the second consecutive year. Lloyd Harris also clinched his qualifier’s spot with victory against a seeded opponent. The South African overcame 2022 Roland Garros semi-finalist Marin Cilic 6-3, 4-6, 6-3. Meanwhile Giulio Zeppieri booked a first-round meeting with defending champion Carlos Alcaraz on the Paris clay. The 23-year-old Italian Zeppieri defeated Federico Agustin Gomez 6-1, 6-4, and later found out he was facing Alcaraz after the Spaniard’s original opponent, Kei Nishikori, withdrew. View key Friday qualifying results from Paris below or click here to catch up on scores from all of the day's matches. Key Results - Friday, QR3 Nikoloz Basilashvili (GEO) def. [WC] Geoffrey Blancaneaux (BEL) 6-2, 6-4 [19] Yannick Hanfmann (GER) def. Titouan Droguet (FRA) 6-4, 3-6, 6-3 Filip Misolic (AUT) def. [2] Alexander Shevchenko (KAZ) 6-4, 6-4 Lloyd Harris (RSA) def. [8] Marin Cilic (CRO) 6-3, 4-6, 6-3 [12] Juan Manuel Cerundolo (ARG) def. [18] Daniel Elahi Galan (COL) 6-4, 6-2 Giulio Zeppieri (ITA) def. [29] Federico Agustin Gomez (ARG) 6-1, 6-4 [NEWSLETTER FORM]

html:
Roland Garros

View key results from Friday's action in Paris

May 23, 2025

AFP/Getty Images

Roland Garros is the second Grand Slam tournament of the season. By ATP Staff

Roland Garros qualifying action came to a close with final-round action Friday, when a host of players earned their way into the main draw of the clay-court major.

Filip Misolic sprung an early third-round surprise by upsetting second seed Alexander Shevchenko 6-4, 6-4. The Austrian won 77 per cent (24/31) of points behind his first delivery, according to Infosys Stats, to wrap an 87-minute victory and qualify for the main draw in Paris for the second consecutive year.

Lloyd Harris also clinched his qualifier’s spot with victory against a seeded opponent. The South African overcame 2022 Roland Garros semi-finalist Marin Cilic 6-3, 4-6, 6-3.

Meanwhile Giulio Zeppieri booked a first-round meeting with defending champion Carlos Alcaraz on the Paris clay. The 23-year-old Italian Zeppieri defeated Federico Agustin Gomez 6-1, 6-4, and later found out he was facing Alcaraz after the Spaniard’s original opponent, Kei Nishikori, withdrew.

View key Friday qualifying results from Paris below or click here to catch up on scores from all of the day's matches.

Key Results - Friday, QR3
Nikoloz Basilashvili (GEO) def. [WC] Geoffrey Blancaneaux (BEL) 6-2, 6-4

[19] Yannick Hanfmann (GER) def. Titouan Droguet (FRA) 6-4, 3-6, 6-3

Filip Misolic (AUT) def. [2] Alexander Shevchenko (KAZ) 6-4, 6-4

Lloyd Harris (RSA) def. [8] Marin Cilic (CRO) 6-3, 4-6, 6-3

[12] Juan Manuel Cerundolo (ARG) def. [18] Daniel Elahi Galan (COL) 6-4, 6-2

Giulio Zeppieri (ITA) def. [29] Federico Agustin Gomez (ARG) 6-1, 6-4
